content: It is the oauth entries but how do they get there? On Win10 all the smtp and imap entries are there but Win11 introduced the oauth entries. It's not a problem as all the passwords are on RasPi 5 Ubuntu 24.04 and Win10
creator: steve446

content:
oauth uses the password only for the initial authentication, and even then is it done on a web page and not saved. When the authentication completes successfully a (I think) 10 digit/character oAuth token issued and is then used between the authenticated device and the provider until such times as the provider either revokes it in which case you will be asked to re-authenticate, or it is replaced with a new token. Reissuing of tokens is done automatically under the hood and there is no user interaction.

It has nothing to do with windows 10 or 11 or Linux or anything operating system. It is all about the changing requirements for authentication imposed by mail providers. SO these days you see no passwords of any substance in Thunderbird. It simply does not know them or use them unless the authentication method is normal password and that is becoming the exception with mail providers. I still use it with GMX, But Outlook, Gmail, Yahoo and AOL all use oauth now
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Klik na prvú správu, ktorú chcem odstrániť (označí sa modro) Stlačím klávesu CTRL a stále ju držím a postupne klikám na správy ktoré chcem odstrániť (všetky sa postupne označujú na modro). Pustím klávesu CTRL a správy ktoré chcem odstrániť zostávajú modré. Nakoniec stlačím klávesu DELETE a sú odstránené.

Pokiaľ v Thunderbirde odstránite e-mail, tak sa v skutočnosti iba označí ako odstránený, ale fyzicky zostane. Jeho fyzické odstránenie sa vykoná až použitím voľby "Údržba priečinkov“. Takže aby ste zmenšili veľkosť priečinka je nutné ešte vykonať "Údržbu priečinkov": https://support.mozilla.org/cs/kb/provedeni-udrzby-slozek. POSTUP: - Thunderbird - Súbor - Vykonať údržbu priečinkov http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/08/19/Thunderbird_udrzba_priecinkov.jpg
creator: Ansamb

content: Jde označit zprávy hromadně např. podle datumu?
creator: l.boscze

content: ANO. Kliknite na dlaždicu DÁTUM - správy sa zoradia podľa dátumu. Klik na prvú správu podľa dátumu, ktorú chcete odstrániť (označí sa modro) Stlačím klávesu SHIFT a stále ju držím a kliknem na poslednú správu podľa dátumu ktoré chcem odstrániť (všetky sa označia na modro). Pustím klávesu SHIFT a správy ktoré chcem odstrániť zostávajú modré. Nakoniec stlačím klávesu DELETE a sú odstránené.
creator: Ansamb

content: My inference is that you replaced one IMAP account with another one. That usually means a new account and new password, so more information will help, since you're concerned about the password. Are you wanting to see messages from old account? Tell me more. Thanks
creator: davidsk

content:
I do not know and neither does anyone else if you do not know it. Only the person who set it will even know it.

See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/protect-your-thunderbird-passwords-primary-password

If you mean your mail account password, rather than a Thunderbird primary password, you will need to consult your email account provider. Thunderbird generally stores passwords in the password manager, but it does not set them and it does not store them for oAuth authenticated mail accounts at all. See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/password-manager-remember-delete-change-tb
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content:
